title: How to Make Ghost Shaped Pizzas

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Roll out the pizza dough.
steps.description: On a clear, floured surface roll out the pizza dough in a thick rectangle using a rolling pin.

steps.headline: Cut out ovals in the pizza dough.
steps.description: Using an oval shaped cookie cutter, cut out ovals to resemble the ghost's shape. Place the dough pieces on a baking tray.

steps.headline: Make the curly edges of the 'ghosts'.
steps.description: Using your fingers, pinch the ends of the ghosts and make curly edges to resemble the ghosts more vividly.

steps.headline: Spread the sauce over the pizzas.
steps.description: Using a spoon, spread the tomato sauce over the pizzas. Avoid adding too much or the pizzas will be soggy. Add about three tablespoons of sauce and spread it across the dough.

steps.headline: Sprinkle cheese over the pizzas.Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the pizzas.
steps.description: Add enough all around the pizzas, making sure each part is covered with cheese.

steps.headline: Add the mushroom  and pineapple as the eyes.
steps.description: Place two mushrooms on each pizza to resemble the ghost's eyes'. Firmly place the two mushrooms side by side near the top of the dough. To make the 'eyebrows', add the pineapple pieces near the top of the mushrooms

steps.headline: Add the tomato as a mouth.
steps.description: Place the cherry tomato near the bottom of the eyes to resemble an 'O' shaped mouth.

steps.headline: Bake the pizzas.
steps.description: Place the pizzas in the oven and have them bake for about 10-13 minutes, until the cheese melts and the pizza crust browns. Remove the ghost pizzas from the oven once fully baked and leave them to cool for about five minutes.

text: Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Roll out the pizza dough. On a clear, floured surface roll out the pizza dough in a thick rectangle using a rolling pin. Cut out ovals in the pizza dough. Using an oval shaped cookie cutter, cut out ovals to resemble the ghost's shape. Place the dough pieces on a baking tray. Make the curly edges of the 'ghosts'. Using your fingers, pinch the ends of the ghosts and make curly edges to resemble the ghosts more vividly. Spread the sauce over the pizzas. Using a spoon, spread the tomato sauce over the pizzas. Avoid adding too much or the pizzas will be soggy. Add about three tablespoons of sauce and spread it across the dough. Sprinkle cheese over the pizzas.Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the pizzas. Add enough all around the pizzas, making sure each part is covered with cheese. Add the mushroom  and pineapple as the eyes. Place two mushrooms on each pizza to resemble the ghost's eyes'. Firmly place the two mushrooms side by side near the top of the dough. To make the 'eyebrows', add the pineapple pieces near the top of the mushrooms Add the tomato as a mouth. Place the cherry tomato near the bottom of the eyes to resemble an 'O' shaped mouth. Bake the pizzas. Place the pizzas in the oven and have them bake for about 10-13 minutes, until the cheese melts and the pizza crust browns. Remove the ghost pizzas from the oven once fully baked and leave them to cool for about five minutes. Serve and enjoy!
